result.execSummary:
The defendant Jacob A Mejia was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Jacob A Mejia is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Jacob A Mejia was found guilty of Possess Drug Paraphernalia, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.573(1).
  • Jacob A Mejia was found guilty of Theft-Movable Property <=$2500 [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Pay all court costs including all applicable surcharges.  If unpaid financial obligations remain at discharge or revocation, civil judgment to be entered.

Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.
*  Pay supervision fees.
*  Pay all court costs including all applicable surcharges.
*  Defendant ordered to submit to a DNA sample & pay DNA surcharge and notice was given.
DOC shall promptly notify the Court of any new arrest or criminal charge made against the Deft.

chargeModifiers.descr: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime

Minutes:  Clerk/T. Lehman.  ADA Kraus appeared for the State.  Deft appeared in person w/Atty Greg Bates.  Warrant vacated; bond reinstated.  Case is resolved.  Victim rights compliance.  Deft pleads guilty to counts 2 & 3; found guilty by the Court.  Count 1 is dismissed on State's motion.  Sentencing arguments made.  Sentence w/held; placed on probation for one year.  See conditions.  DNA ordered; notice given to deft.

Minutes:  Clerk/T. Lehman.  ADA Krejcarek appeared for the State.  Atty Gregory Bates appeared for the deft.  No appearance by deft.  BW authorized; $500 cash bond.  Prior bond forfeited.  JS to remain at this time.
